brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of the protocol is to define the normal humoral and cellular immune responses to
      antigens in volunteers and to define abnormalities of these immune responses in patients
      with immunodeficiency diseases or cancer.  In vitro assays and in vivo skin tests and
      immunization with antigens will be utilized.

clinical_study.brief_title: Studies of the Immune Response in Normal Subjects and Patients With Disorders of the Immune System

detailed_description.textblock:
The goal of the protocol is to define the normal humoral and cellular immune responses to
      antigens in volunteers and to define abnormalities of these immune responses in patients
      with immunodeficiency diseases or cancer.  In vitro assays and in vivo skin tests and
      immunization with antigens will be utilized.

criteria.textblock: Patients will be studied if a disorder of the immune system is suspected.

clinical_study.official_title: Studies of the Immune Response in Normal Subjects and Patients With Disorders of the Immune System

reference.citation: Nelson DL, Blaese RM, Strober W, Bruce R, Waldmann TA. Constrictive pericarditis, intestinal lymphangiectasia, and reversible immunologic deficiency. J Pediatr. 1975 Apr;86(4):548-54.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)
